content: hey guys damn Scottie here welcome to the damps
crap good to have you with me again as I promised with my tools video I do
materials video materials I use to do the DMS craft there are a few things I
may not cover in like little tidbits or whatever but you know sometimes I found
objects or that kind of thing you might use in your crafting but for most almost
all the crafting is just this kind of this is the material I use for it so
this will be a nice overview for the materials you need and/or can move into
as you as you need them you don't have to get really the only prerequisite for
starting the craft is cardboard and cardstock the other materials you can
kind of move into as you need them so let's go to the table and I'll show you
the materials first material I have here is our most basic it's basically
cardboard and cardstock so I just want to talk about the different thicknesses
and kind of show a comparison so here's the thickness of standard cardboard and
here is a thinner cardboard you can see that so you can kind of know the size
difference between the two you can see that this one has bigger corrugation and
this one has a smaller corrugation in it and remember when you cut if you're
cutting strips of this stuff out you always want to cut against the
corrugations if you cut along the edge that has the corrugation the strip's
will be very weak and they'll fall apart if you cut against it so the corrugation
is the length of the strip just the thin strip it'll be much much stronger so you
always want to make sure you do that and then last but least we have cardstock
and it's just a thin card this is actually from just an envelopes box you
can use anything from donut boxes cereal boxes to oatmeal boxes you know anything
that's just made out of cardstock a lot of times I get these these kind of this
kind of cardstock out of the bottom of boxes or that kind of thing if you have
a friend great place to get cardboard if you have a friend that works at some
store just have them save big boxes for you or a cardstock just make them your
your heart boyfriend and they can they can collect that for you if you have a
hard time getting yourself I mean most people work somewhere where they at
least get shipped some kind of boxes so there's usually some selection of boxes
or even if you ship it to your own house you get some selection of boxes but
those are the kind of differences there's also a thicker cardboard which I
have used before it's it's more like something like a refrigerator might be
shipped in and you can get that at actually like stores where they sell
appliances I'm not advocating dumpster diving but you know I have done it
before and it's a great place they're throwing that stuff out hey might as
well utilize it for something useful instead of going to the landfill so
those are the kind of the types of cardboard and now I'm going to move on
to the next material so here I have all this all kinds of wood I've got a pack
of basswood here that I got from a hobby store I got these nice pieces of wood
from a craft store they're called woodsies and they're just like almost
like a coffee stirrer with the ends cut off so these make great you can use
these for all kinds of things these are like a little thinner version more like
coffee stirrers they have rounded edges of these woodsies here and then these
are just bamboo skewers so I think I got this pack for a dollar so it's just full
of these and so if you need if you need a portcullis or something like that you
can use these because they're so long and just cut them off the length of
where you want and last but not least give the serf in here toothpicks you can
use these for all sorts of stuff you've seen me use them all kinds of crafts
just break them off to the length you need them and they
work great they're also handy for doing things like
getting glue in a tight spot or something like that and they're dirty so
you go this there's wood most of these are pretty cheap you get a pack a
toothpicks burg for almost nothing like I said I got these secures for a dollar
these were a little more expensive but not much maybe a dollar or two for these
packs and the best wood was a little more expensive I got it from a
especially hobby retailer but this is gonna last me quite a while I mean you
know probably last me the rest of my crafting life because there's so many
pieces of basswood in here but you can buy them individually at most craft
stores balsa are basswood at most craft stores and even some other big-box
stores so there you go there's wood and I'm going to move on to the next
material so this is air dry clay it's just Crayola air dry clay nothing
special you don't have to bake it you just you just shape it and there you go
you can buy some really cheap clay tools at the craft store to shape it or even
just use some wooden sticks or toothpicks and that kind of thing to
sculpt with so this stuff it this stuff is great because like I say you don't
have to bake it you can just pull it right out there and make whatever you
need now I have used other clays before I have used epoxy clays which you mix
the two together and they become rock-hard which are nice for modifying
models not so good for doing the kind of crafts we're doing and I also have some
made some models out of Scully and scoop super sculpt Lee which is like a clay
that you bake and it becomes hard so that's a night that's a nice clay if
you want to work on something that you want to leave out because this will
drive if you leave it out so if you leave that out it won't harden until you
bake it but I find this this this this stuff is much cheaper and it generally
does the job there's not too much that this this stuff won't do here so this is
a great little addition to your crafting and if you want if you're if you're up
for a little sculpting this stuff is great and there you go and we'll move on
to the next material this is probably going to be the little the most
controversial of my my materials it's fairly expensive I think it's about 20
bucks for a jar like this so it's not cheap but you can do all kinds of nice
textures with this stuff and the thing I like about it is it's flexible so you
know if if your thing bends a little bit or whatever because I've used it on
cardboard and that has some give to it and if it bends a little bit then it
won't just chip off I've had some people say well you could use spackling
compound and that kind of thing and you can you can use that stuff but it will
tend to break off easier than this stuff so you could go that route if it's
something you feel won't get any kind of flex or bump into anything but this
stuff is flexible and strong and it you know if you hit it or drop it or twit
you know bend it it's not going to break off it'll it'll flex with the object so
that's one thing I kind of like about this stuff so and this is not the
mandatory thing I've seen I've done a few crafts with this on my channel I
don't use it a lot I use it a lot I do use it for my for basing my miniatures
like you saw with the crocodile that I did I do use it for that but I don't use
a lot for other than that so this this is probably last me a long
time this jars gonna last me a long time so there's a material you can you can
get it or not but I I'll I really like it and it's
something I recommend if you want to kind of take it to the next level and so
that we'll move on to the next material and last but not least I have our sand
now what I've done is the sand comes in a big bag and it's used for construction
projects now they have the place sand and they have the standard sentence you
want to get the standard sand or the construction sand that they use in
construction projects don't get the place and because it's just sand and
it'll just look like a glob when you use it what I like about what I love about
this this sand the regular sand is it has all different sizes of pebbles and
pieces of sand in it so there's everything down to you know from a sand
grain to small pebbles and that really gives a variance to the texture of the
sand it works great for rubble it looks good on for areas where you're using it
to have dirt and that kind of thing so it just adds some variance to the
texture and just gives it makes it more interesting now when you buy a bit the
problem with this stuff is when you buy a bag it's I don't know of 40 50 pound
bags something like that so it's a big bag of sand so what I do is I just store
it in the garage you can actually put it in a bucket or something like that if
you wanted to and then I just put it in a smaller container and then use it as I
need it so this is just a glass container I'm using I used to put the
sand in and then I use this little cup to pour it on my projects when I use it
so that will be something you'll have to deal with you'll have to deal with
storing that bag of sand but that's a bag of sand will last you your entire
crafting career you'll never need another bag of sand so some people have
to have have suggested to me that kitty litter could be a good substitute
well for one this sand is dirt cheap so this is probably actually cheaper than
the kitty litter but kitty litter is made out of clay and for one I found it
doesn't stick very well with the craft glue or any glue actually it doesn't
stick very well it kind of it kind of floats on the glue instead of sinking
into the glue and really adhering to the surface like the sand does it also is
very fragile it's made of clay so it breaks off very easily so all your all
your dry brushing you know and everything that you've done to it is
it's all going to break off and look like crap so I would not recommend using
cat litter for this for this kind of as a substitute for sand I would just you
know get the sand and use it but I use this I use this all the time like I say
a bag is only a few bucks and they'll last you the rest of your crafting
career the only issue is somewhere in a store it because it's a big bag I've yet
to find a really small one so that is the only issue so that concludes my
materials these are the you know most of my projects I do these are the materials
I use there may be times I may use other materials that I haven't I haven't said
like sometimes I use some rope or something on a project like twine as
rope to give it and a certain appearance wrap it around or whatever but in
general these are really all the materials that you'll need besides of
cardboard and cardstock to really bring your stuff to life and with with this on
top of the the tools video i hope i've helped new people to get into the craft
and kind of realize what they need to work with and i'll see you next time on
the dm's craft
